PPL-DSP¶

PPL-DSP is a inference engine of SenseTime to run model on DSP.

Quantization Scheme¶

8bit per-layer/per-channel asymmetric linear quantization.

\[\begin{equation} q = \mathtt{clamp}(\lfloor x * s \rceil + z, lb, ub) \end{equation}\]

where \(s\) is scaling factor to quantize a number from floating range to integer range, z represents the quantized value of floating zero. \(lb = 0\) and \(ub = 255\) are bounds of integer range.

For weights, all weights can share the same scale \(s\) or each filter has an independent scale \(s\).

When generate the quantized PPL model, you can fill \(s\) and \(z\) as step and zero_point in the prototxt.

Attention

All blobs must have quantization parameters, which can be generated by Dipoorlet/Dirichlet. BN and ReLU are recommended to be merged.

Documentation and Support OPs¶

HPC team provides a PPL_DSP Documentation to show how to use the simulator and gives the list of Hexagon DSP Supported OPs and Ceva DSP Supported OPs.
